title: Devolving power – Permanent Road closures
text: [news] Yesterday (23:05) This is a prime example of what happens when ‘power is devolved’ from Central Government agencies to Local Authorities, giving these ‘Localists’ powers that affect people far beyond their dominion. I would like anyone who has an interest in keeping our roads free of Local Authority permanent closures to take a look at an example plan they have for an area in Brixton, SE London.The Plan: http://www.lambeth.gov.uk/sites/default/files/LJ%2... If anyone can agree that this kind of creeping authoritarianism is something that must be challenged before we are all just stuck on the main arteries in endless jams, whilst the ‘protected areas’ become contrived, remote concrete village greens complete with the obligatory hipster coffee, bike, hover board shops, then perhaps you would consider signing the petition calling for its cancellation. Perhaps you will conclude that it’s ‘a London thing’ or not your problem, but if you do, perhaps you will also consider that this treatment of the road network will only proliferate to the point where it will eventually come to your town/city. This phenomena has been occurring more frequently to the point where navigating London through backroads is becoming impossible.The Petition:
